intro: Rosa afzeliana var. adenophylla, commonly known as the腺叶玫瑰, is a variant of the Afghan rose native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and fragrant pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. It produces rose hips that are often used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in gardens with well-drained soil.
